name: James T. RAAB and Constance Raab, H/W, Appellants, v. KEYSTONE INSURANCE COMPANY, and Ed O'Keefe, Individually and as employee and claims supervisor for Keystone Insurance Company

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
parties: James T. RAAB and Constance Raab, H/W, Appellants, v. KEYSTONE INSURANCE COMPANY, and Ed O’Keefe, Individually and as employee and claims supervisor for Keystone Insurance Company.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted. 271 Pa.Super. 185, 412 A.2d 638.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Anthony P. Baratta, Anthony B. Quinn, Philadelphia, for appellants.
Hugh J. Hutchison, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
437 A.2d 941
James T. RAAB and Constance Raab, H/W, Appellants, v. KEYSTONE INSURANCE COMPANY, and Ed O’Keefe, Individually and as employee and claims supervisor for Keystone Insurance Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 26, 1981.
Decided Dec. 17, 1981.
Petition for Reconsideration Denied Jan. 29, 1982.
Anthony P. Baratta, Anthony B. Quinn, Philadelphia, for appellants.
Hugh J. Hutchison, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, KAUFFMAN and WILKINSON, JJ.
